reviews.review_msg: Dr. Hasan is the best prof I ever had. He has so much intelligence and humour, and is a great guy to know outside of academia. He is a world class lecturer, and cares about helping his students. He appreciates hard work and also rewards it. I did very well in his class because I worked hard, listened to lectures, and asked questions. He's the best.

I am retaking this course in my 4th year, and Emrul has been the best prof I've had at UBC. He's so inspiring, and I learned a lot from him over the whole term. He taught us some practical things too that we can use in our careers. He also gave me some great suggestions about my graduate programs I am planning to take in the future.

I really want to do econ major now after taking this class with Emrul. I had a different thought last term when I took Econ101 with another prof. He makes lectures very interesting with a lot of real-life applications. Highly recommended. Will take more classes with him in the future.

This course is difficult but useful and topics are interesting. The textbook helps a lot in understanding the materials. The prof is really caring and supportive, always talks about interesting things outside class. And the textbook chapters are rearranged by the prof so that it became MUCH more easier to understand.

My advices are: participation mostly comes out of piazza, do that instead of trying to do every homework perfectly; there are at least 3 group projects which are a pain but he is fair and takes peer evaluation into account; doesn't really use econlab or textbook so just review lectures. He is not bad and he is fair. His english is fine too.

Emrul is awesome! His teaching technique is great. More profs should be like him! He's absolutely hilarious. He'll crack a joke during lectures once in a while to keep things from getting dull. It was a three hour lecture, but he made it completely worth it. Would definitely take one of his classes again!
Great Prof. Really funny but the lectures are content heavy and difficult to keep up with if you don't do your own notes before hand.
Will take again. he is funny and gives amazing examples. never bored.

Professor Emrul is an amazing guy. He gives students enough time during office hours when needed. I was having hard time with the course Econ 102, but he convinced me that I can do well and showed me how to study for the final exam.
Emrul is great. He knows the stuff and is very approachable. I would definitely take his class again. BTW he actually looks at this stuff.

Emrul is a funny guy and I enjoyed listening to him speak. Lectures were kind of weird at the beginning when he would let his TA fill the empty time to lecture us on something completely unrelated to economics. It was bizarre to say the least but thankfully it was dropped after a few weeks WHEW. We were also promised cake if we were good. Well?
Emrul was a great teacher, funny guy as well. Highly recommended for an intro or even advanced econ course. Respect him and he will respect you, he's a very fair teacher.

Professor Hasan made econ one of my favourite classes. Honestly, this class isn't a difficult one and perfect for those who have no previous understanding of the material. Yes, it can get confusing when he argues against the textbook during lectures, but I found his perspective as useful.
He is a generous instructor. Attending his classes would help you have a better understanding of economy. The grading scheme is generous and you can get good grades by hard work.

He changed the grading scheme half way through the semester. Goes off on massive tangents. He disagrees with the textbook and gives you contradicting information, leaving you unclear about what you are meant to answer on the final exam.

He's a pretty funny guy and makes the lecture interesting. A little bit of homework each week, but definitely manageable. If you show up to the lecture and take notes, you probably won't need to read the textbook.

He's really funny, I think he usually teaches higher level econ and business courses but he was a decent prof for Econ 102. If you understand the concepts and take time to study you'll do well. Not much homework, and the tests were straightforward enough.
